docs.snippet: Maddux, who was voted into the Hall of Fame on Wednesday, was known for being able to put the ball exactly where he wanted when he pitched....
docs.lead_paragraph: Maddux, who was voted into the Hall of Fame on Wednesday, was known for being able to put the ball exactly where he wanted when he pitched.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column celebrates extraordinary athleticism of pitcher Greg Maddux, who has more wins than any living pitcher, in career that has now earned him entry into the Baseball Hall of Fame.

headline.main: For Greg Maddux, an Unassuming Presence Masked a Master of the Pitching Craft
headline.print_headline: Professor Who Taught the Ball to Dance

docs.snippet: The Baseball Writers’ Association of America permanently stripped Le Batard of his Hall of Fame vote for handing his ballot to Deadspin as a prank....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Baseball Writers’ Association of America permanently stripped Le Batard of his Hall of Fame vote for handing his ballot to Deadspin as a prank.
docs.abstract: Baseball Writers’ Association of America permanently strips Dan Le Batard of his Hall of Fame vote for handing his ballot to website Deadspin as a prank designed to mock the voting process; Le Batard is a freelance columnist for The Miami Herald and the host of television and radio programs for ESPN, his full-time employer.

headline.main: No More Hall of Fame Votes for Dan Le Batard
headline.print_headline: No More Hall Votes for Le Batard

docs.snippet: Verlander, the Detroit Tigers ace, had muscle repair surgery after injuring himself last month during off-season conditioning....
docs.lead_paragraph: Verlander, the Detroit Tigers ace, had muscle repair surgery after injuring himself last month during off-season conditioning.
docs.abstract: Detroit Tigers ace Justin Verlander has muscle repair surgery after injuring himself during off-season conditioning; he is expected to need six weeks of rehabilitation before being evaluated again.

headline.main: Justin Verlander Has Muscle Repair Surgery

docs.snippet: Because an expected bidding war has been delayed by new rules, confusion, infighting and counterproposals, Tanaka has become a figure of intense interest in major league baseball....
docs.lead_paragraph: Because an expected bidding war has been delayed by new rules, confusion, infighting and counterproposals, Tanaka has become a figure of intense interest in major league baseball.
docs.abstract: Masahiro Tanaka has become a figure of unusual interest for Major League Baseball during unexpected bidding war delayed by new rules, confusion, infighting and counter-proposals; dragging out process has created perception that Tanaka is best free agent available.

headline.main: Delays in Bidding Help Put Focus on Masahiro Tanaka
headline.print_headline: Delays in Tanaka Bidding Help Put Focus on Him

docs.snippet: Does the voting process for the Baseball Hall of Fame need to be changed?...
docs.abstract: Does the voting process for the Baseball Hall of Fame need to be changed?

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Philadelphia Daily News sportswriter and columnist Bill Conlin, whose long career came to an end following multiple allegations of child abuse, has died. He was 79.

headline.main: Conlin, Philly Sportswriter Accused of Abuse, Dies

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear a closely watched appeal filed by the four major broadcasters against an online television service, Aereo Inc, backed by media mogul Barry Diller that they claim steals copyright TV content....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear a closely watched appeal filed by the four major broadcasters against an online television service, Aereo Inc, backed by media mogul Barry Diller that they claim steals copyright TV content.

headline.main: U.S. Top Court Agrees to Hear Broadcasters' Case Against Aereo
